author: afdudley
content:
> I think you'd also have to provide witnesses for all the transactions that execute before your "transaction of interest" in the block.
I'm asserting these don't matter if they don't modify the merkle leaves in question, is this correct?

> I don't think there is a single gold standard for trace format, which makes verifying harder
We'd be using an evm trace from geth, not the open ethereum format.

content: We have this for getting state diffs for transactions, but not tied to tracts, but if of interest: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/go-ethereum/pull/118  Code has been updated since but this was the main PR.

author: jason.carver
content:
> I'm asserting these don't matter if they don't modify the merkle leaves in question, is this correct?
If the earlier transactions don't modify the state you care about, then I agree they don't matter. How would the verifier know that the earlier txns don't modify the state in question, without executing them?
